bill.title: Health Insurance; Orthodontic Treatment; Orofacial Anomalies
bill.description: Requires health insurance coverage of orthodontic treatment for orofacial anomalies. Effective 7/1/2050. (SD1)

history.action: Pending introduction.
Introduced and Passed First Reading
Referred to HLT, CPC, FIN, referral sheet 1
Bill scheduled to be heard by HLT on Wednesday, 02-04-15 9:00AM in House conference room 329.
The committee(s) on HLT recommend(s) that the measure be deferred until 02-06-15 at 11:30 AM.
Bill scheduled for decision making on Friday, 02-06-15 11:30AM in House conference room 329.

The committees on HLT recommend that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes were as follows: 8 Ayes: Representative(s) Belatti, Creagan, Hashem, Jordan, Kobayashi, Morikawa, Oshiro, Fukumoto Chang; Ayes with reservations: none; Noes: none; and 1 Excused: Representative(s) Tupola.
Reported from HLT (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 116) as amended in HD 1, recommending passage on Second Reading and referral to CPC.
Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on CPC with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and none excused (0).
Bill scheduled to be heard by CPC on Wednesday, 02-18-15 3:00PM in House conference room 325.

The committees on CPC recommend that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes were as follows: 13 Ayes: Representative(s) McKelvey, Woodson, Belatti, Brower, Creagan, Har, Hashem, C. Lee, Nakashima, Oshiro, San Buenaventura, Takayama, Fukumoto Chang; Ayes with reservations: none; Noes: none; and 3 Excused: Representative(s) Kawakami, Yamane, McDermott.
Reported from CPC (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 540) as amended in HD 2, recommending referral to FIN.
Report adopted. referred to the committee(s) on FIN as amended in HD 2 with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Ito excused (1).
Bill scheduled to be heard by FIN on Thursday, 03-05-15 10:30AM in House conference room 308.

The committees on FIN recommend that the measure be PASSED, UNAMENDED. The votes were as follows: 14 Ayes: Representative(s) Luke, Nishimoto, Cachola, Cullen, DeCoite, Johanson, Jordan, Keohokalole, Kobayashi, Lowen, Onishi, Tokioka, Yamashita, Ward; Ayes with reservations: none; Noes: none; and 1 Excused: Representative(s) Pouha.
Reported from FIN (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 900), recommending passage on Third Reading.
Passed Third Reading with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and none excused (0). Transmitted to Senate.
Received from House (Hse. Com. No. 156).
Passed First Reading.
Referred to HTH/CPN, WAM.
The committee(s) on HTH/CPN has scheduled a public hearing on 03-19-15 9:00AM in conference room 229.

The committee(s) on CPN recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, UNAMENDED. The votes in CPN were as follows: 3 Aye(s): Senator(s) Baker, Nishihara, Wakai; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 1 No(es): Senator(s) Slom; and 3 Excused: Senator(s) Taniguchi, Kahele, Kidani.

The committee(s) on HTH recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, UNAMENDED. The votes in HTH were as follows: 5 Aye(s): Senator(s) Green, Wakai, Baker, Gabbard, Riviere; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 1 No(es): Senator(s) Slom; and 1 Excused: Senator(s) Ruderman.
Reported from HTH/CPN (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 1050) with recommendation of passage on Second Reading and referral to WAM.
Report adopted; Passed Second Reading and referred to WAM.
The committee(s) on WAM will hold a public decision making on 03-31-15 9:00AM in conference room 211.

The committee(s) on WAM recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes in WAM were as follows: 8 Aye(s): Senator(s) Tokuda, Kouchi, Chun Oakland, English, Harimoto, Inouye, Riviere, Ruderman; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 0 No(es): none; and 3 Excused: Senator(s) Dela Cruz, Galuteria, Slom.
Reported from WAM (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 1439) with recommendation of passage on Third Reading, as amended (SD 1).
48 Hrs. Notice 04-14-15.
Report adopted; Passed Third Reading, as amended (SD 1). Ayes, 24; Aye(s) with reservations: none . Noes, 1 (Senator(s) Slom). Excused, 0 (none). Transmitted to House.
Returned from Senate (Sen. Com. No. 515) in amended form (SD 1).
House disagrees with Senate amendment (s).
Received notice of disagreement (Hse. Com. No. 616).
House Conferees Appointed: Belatti, McKelvey, Kobayashi Co-Chairs; Takayama, Fukumoto Chang.
Received notice of appointment of House conferees (Hse. Com. No. 617).
Senate Conferees Appointed: Green Chair; Baker, English Co-Chairs.
Received notice of Senate conferees (Sen. Com. No. 641).
Bill scheduled for Conference Committee Meeting on Friday, 04-24-15 2:30PM in conference room 229.
Conference Committee Meeting will reconvene on Monday 04-27-15 8:45AM in conference room 229.
Conference Committee Meeting will reconvene on Wednesday 04-29-15 8:45AM in conference room 229.
Conference Committee Meeting will reconvene on Thursday 04-30-15 3:05PM in conference room 229.

The Conference Committee recommends that the measure be Passed, with Amendments. The votes were as follows: 5 Ayes: Representative(s) Belatti, McKelvey, Kobayashi, Takayama, Fukumoto Chang; Ayes with reservations: none; 0 Noes: none; and 0 Excused: none.

The Conference committee recommends that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes of the Senate Conference Managers were as follows: 3 Aye(s): Senator(s) Green, Baker, English; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 0 No(es): none; and 0 Excused: none.
Reported from Conference Committee (Conf Com. Rep. No. 110) as amended in (CD 1).
Forty-eight (48) hours notice Tuesday, 05-05-15.
Reported from Conference Committee as amended CD 1 (Conf. Com. Rep. No. 110).
48 Hrs. Notice (as amended CD 1) 05-05-15.
Passed Final Reading, as amended (CD 1). 24 Aye(s); Aye(s) with reservations: none . 1 No(es): Senator(s) Slom. 0 Excused: none.
Passed Final Reading as amended in CD 1 with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Tsuji excused (1).
Received notice of Final Reading (Sen. Com. No. 699).
Received notice of passage on Final Reading in House (Hse. Com. No. 680).
Transmitted to Governor.
